parameters: \pop[2]Isaac leads us all into the hotel room, and the view astounds me.
\pop[2]I can see almost all of Toronto, and it's truly breathtaking.
\pop[2]This is my first time seeing it like this...
\pop[2]Too bad the circumstances weren't a little better.
\pop[2]We all scatter about the room, checking out the amenities.
Couldn't you get a bigger room?
\pop[3]Something tells me it wouldn't be the first time.
\pop[3]So what exactly did you want to explain, Isaac?
There's a lot of talk within \c[10]Argus\c[0] right now.
They kinda dropped the ball on this, bigtime.
\pop[3]A lot of people are quitting in order to help the \c[23]zeros\c[0].
Apparently they're starting to breach other cities, as well.
\pop[3]Well, it's just what \c[10]Argus\c[0] said in their communication.
\pop[4]So they still see us as a threat, then.
\pop[3]It's all professional lingo, I wouldn't take it to heart.
\pop[3]The leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0] is coming out to play.
I guess they want to be present for the revolution.
Right in front of the enemy?
Security will be over the top.
\pop[3]Oh, it definitely will be. In the town square, at least.
But I don't think that's where \c[23]Cipher\c[0] is planning to act.
\pop[4]How long have you known this, exactly?
\pop[2]That must've been what my counselor was so shocked about...
\pop[2]He definitely received an important phone call that day.
\pop[4]So I guess everything is lined up, then.
Survive for \c[14]just\c[0] a few more days, and it's all over.
\pop[3]If you stick by my side, it'll be \c[14]easy\c[0].
But it certainly doesn't help my paranoia.
\pop[2]Isaac rubs the back of his head, clearly nervous.
\pop[3]Well, this is where I have to come clean.
There's something I've been hiding from all of you.
\pop[3]Yeah, and I'm not really proud of it.
But we're at the finish line, so I have to come clean.
\pop[3]I figured it was obvious from the start.
\pop[4]I just thought it was one of those things we weren't talking about.
\pop[4]Who else would've helped me like you did?
\i[3]"I'd be lying if I said I was surprised."
\i[3]"I'd be lying if I said I was surprised."
\pop[3]I had a big reveal planned, and everything!
You're really gonna take this away from me?
\pop[3]Well, \c[14]we're\c[0] not taking it away from you.
You suck at keeping secrets, so it's \c[14]your\c[0] fault.
\pop[3]Well, nobody in the world knows who \c[23]Hermes\c[0] is.
But you keep talking about them like you know them.
\pop[3]Using words like "his" and stuff like that.
You definitely know more than you've let on.
\pop[4]Then there's all those nights you worked late.
And the sales you kept "losing" to illegal modders.
Please stop rubbing in my mistakes.
\pop[2]He laughs, and the atmosphere in the room immediately relaxes.
\pop[3]So now you know why I've kept saying it...
You're safe by my side, because my safety is \c[14]essential\c[0].
\pop[3]It's not just coincidence that my interview is on the fifth.
\pop[3]When everyone's eyes will be on the town square...
\pop[3]I can't say any more than that.
\pop[3]Stick by my side, and you'll be safe.
If you stray away right now, things could go south.
\pop[3]But that's also why I can't tell you the details.
You're free to walk away, as long as you know nothing more.
\pop[3]I can't risk having them interrogate you.
Just stick with me, for a few more days?
\pop[4]And sneak into their HQ with you?
\pop[4]The secrecy isn't helping your case, Isaac.
\pop[3]Sorry, Delta. I looked through footage of The Wayfarer.
I saw you pick up Dante's wallet, but nothing else happened.
\pop[3]But I think this is a tough time for all of us.
My mind has definitely played a few tricks on me, too.
So it's not like you did anything wrong, alright?
\pop[2]I nod, but still don't believe it.
\pop[4]So nothing bad has come of our actions? \c[14]At all\c[0]?
\pop[2]Taylor stares at me, and I shrug.
\pop[4]I'll go along with this. For now.
\pop[3]See? Then there's nothing to worry about.
Look at you, Dante; saying things were horrifying.
One day you'll \c[14]wish\c[0] you could come back and relive this.
\pop[4]Oh, yes. The few weeks where I'm terrified for my safety?
The nostalgia is \c[14]really\c[0] laid on thick, here.
\pop[4]Can we just have fun for the next few days, then?
I've got a panel to run, and I've got a lot to prepare.
\pop[3]Yeah. As long as we stick close to one another.
That means we'll be at your panel, so don't disappoint us~
\pop[2]I guess Isaac expected his true nature to be a "revelation".
\pop[2]But you can't really keep anything from your best friends, can you?
\pop[2]Sometimes, they know you even better than you know yourself.
\pop[2]I definitely had a lingering suspicion, but it's nice to see it confirmed.
\pop[2]A major piece of the puzzle was just locked into place.
\pop[2]And like a puzzle, seeing more of the picture made everything easier.
\pop[2]I'm baffled about the footage Isaac mentioned, though.
\pop[2]I was locked in fright, staring right at that agent in The Wayfarer.
\pop[2]If that was missing, then the footage must've been doctored...
\pop[2]So no matter what he says, I still can't guarantee our safety.
\pop[2]In fact, now that we know he works for \c[23]Cipher\c[0], our danger makes sense.
\pop[2]We weren't an outside case like we thought. Isaac worked for the "enemy".
\pop[3]Is it okay if I have some alone time with Delta?
I just want to talk to them for a few minutes.
\pop[2]Everyone nods, and looks at one another.
\pop[4]Sure picked a good time to move, eh, Delta?
\pop[2]He smirks, as they all start to leave the room.
\pop[2]Isaac wanted to talk to me alone...?
\pop[2]I start to feel a bit worried.
I \c[14]need\c[0] to prepare for that panel.
\pop[2]One by one, they exit the room, leaving us alone.
\pop[2]I look at Isaac, and gulp. What was going on...?
